intro: Dugandiodendron cararense, commonly known as the Carare endemic tree, is a rare and unique species native to the Yucatán Peninsula in Mexico. It is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree characterized by its dense, dark green foliage and distinctive, fragrant flowers. The plant belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many flowering plants with showy blooms. Its botanical features include opposite leaves and small, clustered inflorescences that contribute to its ornamental value. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its natural environment.
